pageContent: Incidental prostate cancer (IPC)--cancer, identified by morphological evaluation of prostate tissue removed during transurethral resection (TUR) or open prostatectomy, in cases where the results of preoperative prostate biopsy revealed no prostate cancer. Literature review presents the data on the incidence of IPC, features of its diagnosis, prediction of tumor progression, and choice of treatment approaches. Many questions remain unresolved and require additional research.

metaData.source:
SPOP-mutant prostate cancer: Translating fundamental biology into patient care
https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/34974131/
